document_data.name: Untie
document_data.refs1e: {{Cite dragon/59/Cantrips: Minor magics for would-be wizards|10}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''Knot''''' was a reversed [[cantrip]] that [[wizard]]s-in-training could learn.{{Cite dragon/59/Cantrips: Minor magics for would-be wizards|6}} It was the reverse of the ''[[tie]]'' cantrip and released normal or magical knots.
document_data.Effects: This cantrip undid the effects of either ''tie'' or ''[[knot]]'' (but not both with one casting) or merely released a normal knot. ''Untie'' also canceled a ''[[tangle]]'' cantrip but left any underlying knots in place. Like its fellow cantrips, ''untie'' had no effect on [[magic item]]s.
document_data.Components: This cantrip required [[verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s to cast, but the gesture was tuned to the type of action desired. Typically, both hands were placed together and then pulled apart as if untying a knot or breaking a length of string. The verbal component was usually a popping noise.
